title: 112_hr1907
content: The Act titled "Infrastructure Facilitation and Habitat Conservation Act of 2011" includes a Conservation Loan and Loan Guarantee Program. The Act "Infrastructure Facilitation and Habitat Conservation Act of 2011" defines key terms such as eligible public entity, program, and Secretary. Eligible public entity includes political subdivisions, regional governance entities, special purpose entities, and joint powers authorities certified by the Governor. The program refers to the conservation loan and loan guarantee program established by the Secretary of the Treasury. The Secretary of the Treasury will establish a loan and loan guarantee program for eligible public entities to acquire real property for habitat conservation plans approved by the Secretary of the Interior under the Endangered Species Act of 1973. Eligible entities must submit an application for consideration. The Secretary will establish a program for eligible public entities to acquire real property for habitat conservation plans. Entities must submit an application with required information. The Secretary will solicit applications at least once per year and approve them promptly. The Secretary of the Interior will review applications from eligible public entities implementing approved habitat conservation plans. The eligible public entity's habitat acquisition program has been approved by the Secretary of the Interior under the Endangered Species Act of 1973. The entity must have a high likelihood of completing the program and have a sustainable infrastructure development plan in place. The Secretary of the Interior must submit a report to the Secretary within 60 days of receiving an application, containing an assessment of factors and a recommendation for approval. The Secretary of the Interior may consult with the Secretary of Commerce for approval or disapproval of a loan or loan guarantee to an eligible public entity. Approval must be made by the Secretary within 120 days of receiving an application. The Secretary must approve or disapprove an application from an eligible public entity within 120 days. Factors considered include the financial plan for habitat acquisition. The Secretary must consider factors such as the ability to repay a loan, any appropriate factors determined by the Secretary, and the recommendation of the Secretary of the Interior when approving or disapproving applications from eligible public entities. The Secretary gives preference to eligible public entities in biologically rich regions where rapid growth threatens habitat conservation plans, as determined in cooperation with the Secretary of the Interior. Administration of loans and loan guarantees includes reporting to the Secretary of the Interior within 60 days of approving or disapproving an application. The Secretary must report the decision to approve or disapprove an application to the Secretary of the Interior. Once approved, the Secretary will establish the loan or loan guarantee for the eligible public entity. The authority to establish a loan or loan guarantee for eligible public entities will terminate 10 years after the enactment of the Act.
